info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued October 12 at 8:05PM MST until October 12 at 9:30PM MST by NWS Tucson AZ
info.description:
At 805 PM MST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is already occurring.
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Radar and automated gauges.
IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Drexel Heights, Three Points, Pascua Pueblo Yaqui Reservation, San Xavier Community, Valencia West, Tucson Estates, Tucson Mountain Park and Ryan AirField.
This includes the following highways... Route 86 between mile markers 151 and 165. Route 286 near mile marker 45.
This includes the following Flash Flood Prone Locations... Mark Rd from Jeffery Rd to Los Reales Rd and Black Wash at S Camino de Oeste.
This includes the following streams and drainages... Santa Cruz River, Soto Wash, South Mendoza Wash, West Branch Santa Cruz River and Brawley Wash.
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 930 PM MST THIS EVENING FOR EAST CENTRAL PIMA COUNTY
